Description.val:
This budget provides for the procurement of Strategic Weapons System (SWS) equipment for deployed ballistic missile submarines (SSBNs) and shore support sites to support the TRIDENT II (D5) program.  Included are shipboard subsystem equipment modernization and technical refresh efforts associated with the TRIDENT II (D5) life extension program.  TRIDENT II SSBN hull life has been extended, therefore extending system life to FY 2042.

OTHER MATERIAL SUPPORT
A broad range of other material support equipment must be procured for deployed SSBNs, shore installations and contractor facilities. Included within this category are general and special purpose test equipment, launcher expendables, navigation principal items, test instrumentation in support of missile flight tests, and missile checkout equipment.

ALTERATIONS
Alterations to non-flying tactical hardware are continuing requirements for the SWS. Requirements primarily relate to shipboard investments in Commercial-off-the-Shelf/Non-Developmental Items (COTS/NDI) SWS subsystem equipment, including periodic refresh cycles, to ensure continued reliable performance of the weapon system for its extended service life to match the OHIO Class life extension. Strategic Programs Alterations (SPALTs) also entail the application of available technology to eliminate personnel safety hazards, correct design deficiencies, maintain system effectiveness by resolving equipment operability problems, achieve logistic economies, and provide for shipboard subsystem D5 life extension modernization efforts.

Funds are required to procure alterations to the SWS launcher and fire control subsystems; to inertial, non-inertial, and ESGN navigation subsystem equipment on deployed SSBNs and installed at supporting shore facilities, including the TRIDENT Training Facility (TTF), Bangor, TTF, Kings Bay, the Ashore Navigation Center, and the Inertial System Test Laboratory; to test instrumentation used on SSBNs, support ships and at the Eastern Test Range, the TRIDENT Refit Facility (TRF), Bangor, and TRF, Kings Bay; and to missile handling equipment, missile test and readiness equipment, and surface support equipment. Installation of approved SPALTs is performed on a turnkey basis in conjunction with the procurement of equipment. Use of COTS/NDI has been initiated and is being implemented in all subsystems, wherever possible.

The majority of the Alterations funding supports the Shipboard System Integration (SSI) program which utilizes a COTS based strategy that integrates common electronics (from Fire Control, Launcher, Navigation and Shipboard Data Recording Systems) into the fire control sub-system as well as refreshing inertial systems in order to ensure the TRIDENT II (D5) weapon system can be sustained to FY 2042 in support of OHIO Class SSBNs. Below is a description of each SSI Increment (Inc):

SSI Inc 1:  Provide subsystems integration into the MOD 6/7 Tech Refresh for the Fire Control System (FCS) leaving the missile and guidance system interface unchanged.  Also provides Ship/Strategic Weapons Support System (SWSS) SHIPALT's for ship interfaces that comprise of power, missile tube cabling, radio room, and Fire Control (FC) cabling.  Installation is accomplished during 50 day refit without missile offload.

SSI Inc 2:  Introduction of an integrated Shipboard Data Systems (SDS) which is comprised of Data Recording Subsystem (DRS), Maintenance Information Network (MIN), and Electronic Work Log (EWL) subsystems.  the DRS legacy functionality, connectivity, equipment is unchanged.  The EWL subsystem provides software upgrades and the Window 7 Operating System upgrade.  Provides subsystem SPALTs for SDS and Strategic Weapon System Maintenance Information Network (SWSMIN) and refresh portable computing devices.

SSI Inc 4:  Prerequisite is SSI Inc 1 and Inc 2.  Inc 4 provides SWS Subsystem SPALTs which includes Mod 6/7 FCS Refresh SPALT, Navigation (NAV) Radio Frequency (RF) SPALT, SDS SPALT, and Cabling SPALT.  For the FC Mod 6/7 Refresh it contains the technical refresh, integration and commonality of the system.  The DRS legacy software modifies the support of the new NAV/SHIP/DRS and NAV/FC interfaces and format changes.  for Navigation changes, the equipment remains in NAV Center.  Supplies the first technical refresh in 25 years for Navigation Aids (NAVAIDS0 Electronics, frequency standard, workstation, and NAV Control Panel (NCP).

SSI Inc 8: Inc 8 provides replacement of the 30 year old ESGN which needs a refresh of inertial technology components, replacement of the Electronic Equipment Consoles (EEC), and updates Navigation Subsystem software to accommodate ESGN replacement navigator. Also, provides SWS subsystem SPALTs for FC and TTF NAV Lab trainers, and SDS (DRS) Software SPALT changes which are driven by data requirement changes. The SHIPALTs retain NAV Center bedplate, cabling, chilled water/ventilation, and retain electrical Power.

SSI Inc 10: Inc 10 provides for the refresh of Shipboard Data Systems.

SSI Inc 11: Launcher Initiation System (LIS) is being developed for backfit onto OHIO Class D5LE. This provides a technical refresh of 30+ year old technology to ensure long term system reliability. SHIP/SWSS SHIPALT are to replace electrical cable with hybrid fiber-optic/electrical cable.

SSI Inc 13: Inc 13 provides Shipboard Systems Refresh for FCS, NAV, and Missile Test and Readiness Equipment (MTRE) to integrate within the subsystems.

SSI Inc 15: Prerequisite is SSI Inc 13. Inc 15 provides pre-configuration and post-configuration support of Inc 8 and Inc 11. Inc 15 provides refresh alterations for fire control equipment, navigation, launcher, and trainer subsystems.

SSI Inc 16: Prerequisite is SSI Inc 15.  Inc 16 provides Fire Control Subsystem refresh of SSI Inc 13 components, technical refresh of Shipboard Data System (SDS) subsystems, technical refresh of Navigation SSI Inc 4, technical refresh of Launcher Variable Energy Eject (VEE) actuators to address obselence to sustain the fleet.
Shipboard Systems Integration: Efforts in this cost code focus on capturing legacy fire control and navigation subsystem behavior to develop a functional model to inform future SSI increments.    

TRAINING

This category provides for procurement of, and alterations to, both tactical and non-tactical equipment required at submarine training facilities to train personnel in the operation and maintenance of launcher and handling, fire control, navigation, missile checkout, and test instrumentation subsystems. Each training facility consists of an integrated family of system and unit laboratories that interface with a training simulation system to provide complete and realistic training for replacement and off-crew personnel, both officer and enlisted, as required for manning of SSBNs and shore facilities. Funding is budgeted to procure training-unique equipment required as the result of alterations to SWS tactical equipment, including those associated with D-5 life extension.

NEW START 
Funding in this category is in support of the Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty (New START) signed into law on 5 February 2011. New START is a nuclear arms reduction treaty between the United States and the Russian Federation which limits the number of deployed launchers.



COLUMBIA CLASS

Funding in this category is in support of the Columbia class SSBN for the procurement of trainer equipment.

Justification.val:
OTHER MATERIAL SUPPORT 
A broad range of other material support equipment must be procured for deployed SSBNs, shore installations and contractor facilities. Included within this category are general and special purpose test equipment, launcher expendables, navigation principal items, test instrumentation in support of missile flight tests, and missile checkout equipment. Amounts included within this P1 line for this category are subdivided as follows:

Launcher and Handling Equipment (Cost code 1.2 & 1.5): Funding in FY 2020 continues to procure 10  MK-74 Gas Generator (GG) procurements to support missile launch operations and the life extension of the Gas Generators.  Funding also increases to complete the Ballast installation of the ballast cans that were procured due to the decision to keep SSBN 730/731 as Strategic assets.

Fire Control Equipment (Cost code 2.1-2.6): Funding in FY 2020 provides for procurement of continued capital maintenance projects at the Naval Industrial Reserve Ordnance Plant (NIROP) in Pittsfield, MA.  These projects are essential to correct environmental, safety, and energy conservation deficiencies. Funding also provides procurement of hardware and software for targeting, funding for the RT-WEG program, technology refresh of Fire Control Auxiliary Support Equipment as well as the integration of Navy Enterprise Resource Planning (NERP) and the Advanced Inventory Logistics (SAIL) to track tactical support equipment.

Navigation Equipment (Cost code 3.3): Funding in FY 2020 provides for factory test equipment refresh to Non-Inertial Navigation Sonar System (NSS) and the Frequency Standard module as well as a series of high complexity tests for non-inertial and inertial Navigation components.  Funding is required for replacement of worn or damaged inertial test equipment used at contractors' plants to support test, evaluation, and analysis of inertial instruments. 

Instrumentation/Missile Test Equipment (Cost code 4.1, 4.4-4.5): Funding in all years provides for shore based and shipboard test instrumentation equipment in support of missile flight tests. Funding in FY 2020 provides for the refresh of the SMART Antenna which is the only system available to the Department to record Reentry Body (RB) data in the terminal (impact) area during required D5 missile flights, as there are no land-based sensors available which can fulfill the requirements for reentry telemetry coverage.  Funding in FY20 also provides for Flight Test Support System (FTSS) IV and Portable Navy GPS Translator Processor (PNGTP) Refresh and the procurement of umbilical cable shipsets which are used to replace Umbilical's after approximately twenty years of use, to ensure no reliability degradation and to support the TRIDENT unique portion of the Range refresh of the Command Destruct Transmitter. 

Information Technology (Cost code 5.1): Funding in all years provides for IT equipment acquisitions (hardware and related software) in support of the Strategic Systems Programs. This includes the IT hardware and software components connected to the Strategic Weapons System Network (SWSNET).

ALTERATIONS
Alterations to non-flying tactical hardware are continuing requirements for the SWS. Requirements primarily relate to shipboard investments in Commercial-off-the-Shelf/Non-Developmental Items (COTS/NDI) SWS subsystem equipment, including periodic refresh cycles, to ensure continued reliable performance of the weapon system for its extended service life to match the OHIO Class life extension. Strategic Programs Alterations (SPALTs) also entail the application of available technology to eliminate personnel safety hazards, correct design deficiencies, maintain system effectiveness by resolving equipment operability problems, achieve logistic economies, and provide for shipboard subsystem D5 life extension modernization efforts.

Funds are required to procure alterations to the SWS launcher and fire control subsystems; to inertial, non-inertial, and ESGN navigation subsystem equipment on deployed SSBNs and installed at supporting shore facilities, including the TRIDENT Training Facility (TTF), Bangor, TTF, Kings Bay, the Ashore Navigation Center, and the Inertial System Test Laboratory; to test instrumentation used on SSBNs, support ships and at the Eastern Test Range, the TRIDENT Refit Facility (TRF), Bangor, and TRF, Kings Bay; and to missile handling equipment, missile test and readiness equipment, and surface support equipment. Installation of approved SPALTs is performed on a turnkey basis in conjunction with the procurement of equipment. Use of COTS/NDI has been initiated and is being implemented in all subsystems, wherever possible.

Launcher and Handling Equipment (Cost code 6.4):  Funding in FY 2020 provides for major Launcher SPALT activities including Maintenance Platform refresh, Ejector Group Handling Equipment (EGHE) refresh, Variable Energy Eject (VEE) Actuator refurbishment and Davit SPALT to address aging and obsolescence issues. 

Fire Control Equipment (Cost code 7.2):  Funding in FY 2020 supports refreshes of the fire control software (FCS) with the initial development and systems requirements review for FCS X56.  The scope of one FC redesign will correct between 85 and 100 software defects, as well as include approximately 25 software modifications.

Navigation Equipment (Cost code 8.3-8.5):  Funding in FY20 provides support for efforts in problem correction, fleet documentation, and system modeling and simulations related to the Navigation system.  Transducer (non-inertial) and Navigation SPALTS are being procured to replace legacy equipment.  Additionally, FY 2020 efforts will continue to support testing of Navigation software code.

Instrumentation/Missile Checkout equipment (Cost code 9.1): FY 2020 funding provides for Forecast Instrumentation SPALT for hardware modification to submarine instrumentation of flight systems.
The majority of the Alterations funding supports the Shipboard System Integration (SSI) program which utilizes a COTS based strategy that integrates common electronics (from Fire Control, Launcher, Navigation and Shipboard Data Recording Systems) into the fire control sub-system as well as refreshing inertial systems in order to ensure the TRIDENT II (D5) weapon system can be sustained to FY 2042 in support of OHIO Class SSBNs. Below is a description of each SSI Increment (Inc):


SSI Inc 8: Prerequisite is SSI Inc 4. Inc 8 provides replacement of the 30 year old Electrostatic Gyro Navigator (ESGN) which needs a refresh of inertial technology components, replacement of the Electronic Equipment Consoles (EEC), and updates to Navigation Subsystem software to accommodate the ESGN replacement navigator. Also, provides SWS subsystem SPALTs for FC and TTF NAV Lab trainers, and SDS (DRS) Software SPALT changes which are driven by data requirement changes. The SHIPALTs retain NAV Center bedplate, cabling, chilled water/ventilation, and retain electrical Power.  The ESGN replacement program is highly complex and has required additional resources in FY19 than shown in the PB19 budget submission.  Additional funding out of cost codes 17.1-17.4 was realigned to this program as it has required additional development cycles, testing and qualification.  The current ESGN was designed in the early 1980's and deployed in 1983 with a 20 year designed service live.  This refresh is critical to ensure the program continues to meet STRATCOM requirements. 

Efforts funded in Cost codes 13.4-13.6 & 13.8-13.10 in FY 2020 include:
-Gyroscope and Inertial Navigation System (INS) performance and qualification testing
-Validation testing of fleet and trainer documentation
-Gyroscope Production QTY increases from 31 to 67 QTY in FY 2020 including special test equipment, long lead material procurement, and acceptance testing. 
-INS Production of 2 units.
-Increase in production to support life of type buys for Gyroscope's, Integrated Optical Circuits, Optical Fiber, and various other materials need for the deployment of the gyroscopes.
-Independent Verification and Validation for Inc 8 efforts
-INS Production Software testing and qualification
-SSBN validation testing and trainer installation support
-Navigation SHIPALT in FY 2020 supports installation for proofing boat as well as an additional 2 boats 
-Inc 8 Installation procedure and coordination definition

SSI Inc 10: Prerequisite is SSI Inc 2. Inc 10 provides for the refresh of Shipboard Data Systems.

SSI Inc 11: Launcher Initiation System (LIS) is being developed for backfit onto OHIO Class D5LE SSI Inc 1 is a prerequisite. This provides a technical refresh of 30+ year old technology to ensure long term system reliability. SHIP/SWSS SHIPALT are to replace electrical cable with hybrid fiber-optic/electrical cable.

Efforts funded in Cost codes 15.5-15.7 in FY 2020 include:
-Procure Launcher SSI Inc 11 two (2) shipsets of Laser Firing Units 
-Installation of LIS SPALT kits and Fiber optic Cables

SSI Inc 13: Prerequisite is SSI Inc 4. Inc 13 provides Shipboard Systems Refresh for FCS, NAV, and Missile Test and Readiness Equipment (MTRE) to integrate within the subsystems.

Efforts funded in Cost codes 16.1, 16.7-16.9 in FY 2020 include:
-MTRE refresh to integrate with Fire Control software changes for SSI Inc 13 for the first proofing boat as well as beginning to support the SSI Increment 15 MTRE preliminary design review and system preliminary design review to prepare for kit procurements in FY21. 
-Procure and install Fire Control SSI Inc 13 Electronics' Refresh SPALTS Kits with a QTY 6  
-Complete the refresh and redesign of Fire Control Inc 13

SSI Inc 15: Prerequisite is SSI Inc 13. Inc 15 provides pre-configuration and post-configuration support of Inc 8 and Inc 11.  Inc 15 is a critical path and the baseline for the deployment of the COLUMBIA class SSBN.  Inc 15 involves refreshes to several subsystem such as alterations for fire control equipment, navigation, launcher, and trainer subsystems.  Due to the developmental challenges experienced for SSI Increment 8 during the engineering and test phase, Strategic Systems Programs (SSP) reduced the efforts of SSI increment 15 to the minimally required effort to address obsolescence issues which are required for the SWS to be the initial baseline for the COLUMBIA class SSBN.  Funding in FY19 was prioritized towards the SSI Increment 8 program specifically for the Launcher and Navigation subsystems.
Efforts funded in Cost Codes 17.1-17.2, 17.4 in FY 2020 include:
-Fire Control SSI Inc 15 development is for Systems Preliminary Design Review (PDR), Software Requirements Review, Hardware Concept Design Review (CDR).  Procurement and test of Life-cycle Cost Control (LCCC)/Technology Refresh SPALTs planned for fleet implementation to minimize impacts to USSTRATCOM targeting revisions.
-Preliminary Launcher SSI Inc 15 refresh/redesign efforts and support to the Fire Control Increment 15 development.

SSI Inc 16: Prerequisite is SSI Inc 15.  Inc 16 provides Fire Control Subsystem refresh of SSI Inc 13 components, technical refresh of Shipboard Data System (SDS) subsystems, technical refresh of Navigation SSI Inc 4, and technical refresh of Launcher Variable Energy Eject (VEE) actuators to address obsolesce to sustain the fleet.
Shipboard System Integration (Cost code 19.1) cost code provides funding to build legacy fire control and navigation system models to support future SSI Increments.  These models will identify the functions required for the subsystems and will help shape the future subsystems architecture which could lead to future cost savings.  
TRAINING SUPPORT EQUIPMENT 

This category provides for procurement of, and alterations to, both tactical and non-tactical equipment required at submarine training facilities to train personnel in the operation and maintenance of launcher and handling, fire control, navigation, missile checkout, and test instrumentation subsystems. Each training facility consists of an integrated family of system and unit laboratories that interface with a training simulation system to provide complete and realistic training for replacement and off-crew personnel, both officer and enlisted, as required for manning of SSBNs and shore facilities. Funding is budgeted to procure training-unique equipment required as the result of alterations to SWS tactical equipment, including those associated with D-5 life extension.
Funds in Cost code 20.1 are required for software and hardware design modification, lab documentation modification, facility modification, and design and system integration, as well as procurement and fabrication of all hardware needed to support Navigation and Fire Control subsystem training at both the TTF, Bangor, and at TTF, Kings Bay. The required effort includes upgrade of the Bangor and Kings Bay Navigation and Fire Control trainers from SSI Inc 8 and Inc 13, Integration of Fire Control SSI Inc 8 PC Simulation, Inc 8 and Inc 13 Curricula development, and development of the Virtual Strategic Weapons System (SWSD) classroom trainers. Funding also addresses the need for acquisition of upgrades to the Bangor and Kings Bay TTFs resulting from tactical changes in the TRIDENT II (D5) missile under the Life Extension (LE) program. FY 2020 tasks will include the SSI Inc 13 Simulation and Training, Inc 13 Curricula development, and SSI Inc 13 software updates to the Fire Control System network and modifies the Navigation interface.

Name.val: 1) Other Material Support- Launcher and Handling Equipment

Name.@footnote: Increases to complete the Ballast installation of the ballast cans that were procured due to the decision to keep SSBN 730/731 as Strategic assets.

Name.val: 1.6) Second Explosives Handling Wharf (EHW) Support Equipment

Name.@footnote: Increase from FY19 to FY20 to bring the SSP Advanced Inventory and Logisitics (SAIL) into compliance with Information Assurance reforms.  SAIL is an inventory management system used across the Strategic Weapon System program.
Increase from FY19 to FY20 due to fire control software updates needed to meet strategic priorities
The RT-Weg consists of updates to the fire control system requested by USSTRATCOM to create a SLBM flexibility and efficiency enhancement program.

Name.val: 3.1) Stable Platform and Housing Material Kits

Name.@footnote: Increase from FY19 to FY20 due to the factory test equipment refresh of the Non-Inertial Navigation Sonar System (NSS) and the Frequency Standard module, as well as high complexity tests of non-inertial and inertial Navigation components.

Name.val: 4) Other Material Support- Instrumentation/Missile Checkout Equipment

Name.@footnote: Increase from FY19 to FY20 for the refresh of the SMART Antenna which is the only system available to the Department to record Reentry Body (RB) data in the terminal (impact) area during required D5 missile flights, as there are no land-based sensors available which can fulfill the requirements for reentry telemetry coverage.  Additional funding in FY20 also provides for Flight Test Support System (FTSS) IV and Portable Navy GPS Translator Processor (PNGTP) Refreshes. These critical Flight Test Instrumentation systems operate in the launch area during a SSBN TRIDENT D5 Missile test launch. The refresh replaces critical safety system components essential to Range safety of the TRIDENT D5 test launch. These systems provide real time data, voice communications, and SSBN tracking information for range safety in the Launch Area to include Mean Time to Endanger of US mainland.

Name.@footnote: Increase from FY19 to FY20 is due largely to production QTYs (31 to 67), production test equipment, and life of type material kits, as well as acceptance testing.  Unit pricing in years 2017-2020 is not reflective of true unit pricing due to procurements in those years of life of type materials, and production special test equipment.  Both the US & UK quantities are procured for the same production line and this budget only reflects the US quantities.  Total quantity variation also effects the unit costs reflected.  In FY18, a total of 48 units were procured (24 each US/UK).  In FY19, a total of 31 units are being procured, US/UK quantities are 31/0 respectively.  In FY20, a total of 84 units are being procured, US/UK quantities are 67/17 respectively.
